text:
Oscillators are another group of tools technical analysts use to identify overbought
or oversold markets. These indicators are based on market prices but scaled so that
they "oscillate” around a given value, such as zero, or between two values such as zero
and 100. Extreme high values of an oscillator are viewed as indicating that a market
is overbought, while extreme low values are viewed as indicating an oversold market.
Technical analysts use charts of oscillators over time to highlight periods when they are
near their high or low extremes.
